item.title: Javascript Date
item.description: So I need a way to represent LocalDate that can be found in java.time package. Turns out it’s harder than it looks. Take LocalDateTime for example: LocalDateTime is a relative date that’s the same no matter which time zone you’re in. The easiest thing is to just use string: 2020-07-25T01:02:03. Note that there is no zone/offset information in the string But if you want to use a Date object in javascript to represent it, it gets very tricky.
